intro: Wurmbea australis, commonly known as the Australian yellow nightshade, is a perennial herb native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow, bell-shaped flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and swampy areas. Wurmbea australis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
